intro: Plectronia leytensis, commonly known as the Leyte plectronia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, such as forests and undergrowth. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
